statements.name: PROC DLMZTRAIN

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies an in-memory table that is used to store the data for training a deep learning model.

arguments.name: BASEPATH=
arguments.description: specifies the base path that is used for path-based extra options. For example, if you specify a path to pretrained weights in the extra options, the model path is specified relative to this base path.

arguments.name: CACHEIMAGES=
arguments.description: specifies how images should be cached during training.

arguments.name: DROPLAST
arguments.description: skips the last batch of an epoch if the last batch is not a full batch.

arguments.name: INPUTINDEXMAP=
arguments.description: specifies the table that contains the mapping from character labels to numeric labels.

arguments.name: INMODEL=
arguments.description: specifies the table that contains the model that you would like to train.

arguments.name: IOUTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the intersection-over-union used for training YOLO models.

arguments.name: LOGLEVEL=
arguments.description: specifies the level of detail that is printed to the log.
arguments.help: LOGLEVEL=ERROR | WARNING | NOTE | INFO | DEBUG | TRACE | TRACEMODEL

arguments.name: ERROR
arguments.description: prints only error messages to the log.

arguments.name: WARNING
arguments.description: prints error and warning messages to the log.

arguments.name: NOTE
arguments.description: prints error, warning, and note messages to the log.

arguments.name: INFO
arguments.description: prints error, warning, note, and informative messages to the log.

arguments.name: DEBUG
arguments.description: prints all lower-level messages and useful debugging information.

arguments.name: TRACE
arguments.description: prints all lower-level messages and step-by-step detail of the procedure.

arguments.name: TRACEMODEL
arguments.description: prints all lower-level messages and step-by-step detail of the model.

arguments.name: NTHREADS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of threads to use per worker.

arguments.name: OUTMODEL=
arguments.description: specifies an in-memory table that is used to store the model and model weights.

arguments.name: OUTPUTINDEXMAP=
arguments.description: specifies the table in which to write the mapping from character labels to numeric labels.

arguments.name: TABLEDISTRIBUTION=
arguments.description: specifies how data is distributed in a Massively Parallel Processing environment.

arguments.name: VALIDATIONTABLE=
arguments.description: specifies an in-memory table that is used to store the data for validating a deep learning model.

statements.name: ADDIMAGETRANSFORMATION
statements.description: Applies transformations to images before they are supplied to the model.

arguments.name: IMAGERESIZETYPE=
arguments.description: specifies how the image is resized.

arguments.name: TO_FIX_DIM
arguments.description: resizes the image according to the values specified in the image size field.

arguments.name: RETAIN_ASPECTRATIO
arguments.description: reads one value from the size field and uses that as the larger side (height or width) of the image. The other value is scaled in order to preserve the aspect ratio of the image.

arguments.name: IMAGESIZE=
arguments.description: specifies the size of the image in pixels.

statements.name: EXTRAOPTIONS
statements.description: Applies model-specific options specified in a YAML file.

arguments.name: YAML_FILE=
arguments.description: specifies the file that contains YAML-specified options.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: identifies the YAML document in the file specified by YAML_FILE in case there are multiple YAML documents of the same analysis type.

statements.name: GPU
statements.description: Specifies options for training the model with GPU processing.

arguments.name: DEVICES=
arguments.description: specifies GPU device IDs for the analysis.

statements.name: INDEXVARIABLES
statements.description: Converts character-valued labels into integer-valued labels.

arguments.name: variables
arguments.description: specifies a list of variables that are used to map character-valued labels to integer-valued labels. When used with the INPUTINDEXMAP option, these variables specify which columns should be read. When used with the OUTPUTINDEXMAP option, these variables specify the names to assign to the written columns.

statements.name: INPUT
statements.description: Specifies the input variables used in the analysis.

arguments.name: variables
arguments.description: specifies a list of variables in the data table that are used to define training input.

statements.name: MODELOPTIONS
statements.description: Applies model-specific options by internally generating a YAML file.

arguments.name: CASLIB
arguments.description: specifies the caslib in which the model is stored.

arguments.name: DATASETTYPE
arguments.description: specifies the type of data set.

arguments.name: DLXLABEL
arguments.description: specifies a label to use when generating a YAML document.

arguments.name: ENCODING
arguments.description: specifies the size of the output tensor.

arguments.name: MODELNAME
arguments.description: specifies the name of the model. This field is used only for TorchNative models.

arguments.name: MODELTYPE
arguments.description: specifies the type of model.

arguments.name: NUMCLASSES
arguments.description: specifies the number of classes that are used for the image classification component of the model.

statements.name: OPTIMIZER
statements.description: Specifies the settings for the optimization algorithm used to train the model.

arguments.name: ALGORITHM
arguments.description: specifies the optimization algorithm and algorithm-specific options.

arguments.name: ADAGRAD
arguments.description: AdaGrad options include the following:

arguments.name: EPS=
arguments.description: specifies the term added to the denominator to improve numerical stability.

arguments.name: LR_DECAY=
arguments.description: specifies the learning rate decay of the optimization method.

arguments.name: WEIGHT_DECAY
arguments.description: specifies the weight decay (L2 penalty) of the optimizer.

arguments.name: INITVALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the initial weight decay value to begin tuning.

arguments.name: LOGSCALE=
arguments.description: specifies how to scale the weight decay range.

arguments.name: LOWERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the lower bound of the weight decay range.

arguments.name: SCALEFACTOR=
arguments.description: specifies the factor by which the learning rate range is scaled.

arguments.name: UPPERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the upper bound of the learning rate range.

arguments.name: VALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the value to use for the learning rate.

arguments.name: VALUELIST=
arguments.description: specifies a list of candidate values to use for the learning rate.

arguments.name: ADAM
arguments.description: Adam options include the following:

arguments.name: BETA1=
arguments.description: specifies the exponential decay rate for the first moment in an ADAM-based optimizer.

arguments.name: INITVALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the initial BETA1 value to begin tuning.

arguments.name: LOGSCALE=
arguments.description: specifies how to scale the BETA1 range.

arguments.name: LOWERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the lower bound of the BETA1 range.

arguments.name: SCALEFACTOR=
arguments.description: specifies the factor by which the BETA1 range is scaled.

arguments.name: UPPERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the upper bound of the BETA1 range.

arguments.name: VALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the value to use for the BETA1 parameter.

arguments.name: VALUELIST=
arguments.description: specifies a list of candidate values to use for the BETA1 parameter.

arguments.name: BETA2=
arguments.description: specifies the exponential decay rate for the second moment in an ADAM-based optimizer.

arguments.name: INITVALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the initial BETA2 value to begin tuning.

arguments.name: LOGSCALE=
arguments.description: specifies how to scale the BETA2 range.

arguments.name: LOWERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the lower bound of the BETA2 range.

arguments.name: SCALEFACTOR=
arguments.description: specifies the factor by which the BETA2 range is scaled.

arguments.name: UPPERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the upper bound of the BETA2 range.

arguments.name: VALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the value to use for the BETA2 parameter.

arguments.name: VALUELIST=
arguments.description: specifies a space-separated list of candidate values to use for the BETA2 parameter.

arguments.name: EPS=
arguments.description: specifies the term added to the denominator to improve numerical stability.

arguments.name: AMSGRAD
arguments.description: when set to True, the AMSGrad variant of the ADAM algorithm is used.

arguments.name: WEIGHT_DECAY
arguments.description: specifies the weight decay (L2 penalty) of the optimizer.

arguments.name: INITVALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the initial weight decay value to begin tuning.

arguments.name: LOGSCALE=
arguments.description: specifies how to scale the weight decay range.

arguments.name: LOWERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the lower bound of the weight decay range.

arguments.name: SCALEFACTOR=
arguments.description: specifies the factor by which the learning rate range is scaled.

arguments.name: UPPERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the upper bound of the learning rate range.

arguments.name: VALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the value to use for the learning rate.

arguments.name: VALUELIST=
arguments.description: specifies a list of candidate values to use for the learning rate.

arguments.name: ADAMW
arguments.description: ADAMW includes the following options:

arguments.name: BETA1=
arguments.description: specifies the exponential decay rate for the first moment in an ADAM-based optimizer.

arguments.name: INITVALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the initial BETA1 value to begin tuning.

arguments.name: LOGSCALE=
arguments.description: specifies how to scale the BETA1 range.

arguments.name: LOWERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the lower bound of the BETA1 range.

arguments.name: SCALEFACTOR=
arguments.description: specifies the factor by which the BETA1 range is scaled.

arguments.name: UPPERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the upper bound of the BETA1 range.

arguments.name: VALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the value to use for the BETA1 parameter.

arguments.name: VALUELIST=
arguments.description: specifies a list of candidate values to use for the BETA1 parameter.

arguments.name: BETA2=
arguments.description: specifies the exponential decay rate for the second moment in an ADAM-based optimizer.

arguments.name: INITVALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the initial BETA2 value to begin tuning.

arguments.name: LOGSCALE=
arguments.description: specifies how to scale the BETA2 range.

arguments.name: LOWERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the lower bound of the BETA2 range.

arguments.name: SCALEFACTOR=
arguments.description: specifies the factor by which the BETA2 range is scaled.

arguments.name: UPPERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the upper bound of the BETA2 range.

arguments.name: VALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the value to use for the BETA2 parameter.

arguments.name: VALUELIST=
arguments.description: specifies a space-separated list of candidate values to use for the BETA2 parameter.

arguments.name: EPS=
arguments.description: specifies the term added to the denominator to improve numerical stability.

arguments.name: AMSGRAD
arguments.description: when set to True, the AMSGrad variant of the ADAM algorithm is used.

arguments.name: WEIGHT_DECAY
arguments.description: specifies the weight decay (L2 penalty) of the optimizer.

arguments.name: INITVALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the initial weight decay value to begin tuning.

arguments.name: LOGSCALE=
arguments.description: specifies how to scale the weight decay range.

arguments.name: LOWERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the lower bound of the weight decay range.

arguments.name: SCALEFACTOR=
arguments.description: specifies the factor by which the learning rate range is scaled.

arguments.name: UPPERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the upper bound of the learning rate range.

arguments.name: VALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the value to use for the learning rate.

arguments.name: VALUELIST=
arguments.description: specifies a list of candidate values to use for the learning rate.

arguments.name: LBFGS
arguments.description: LBFGS includes the following options:

arguments.name: LINESEARCHMETHOD=
arguments.description: specifies line-search algorithms used in L-BFGS solver.

arguments.name: LR
arguments.description: specifies learning rate options as a space-separated list of one or more name-value pairs.

arguments.name: INITVALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the initial learning rate to start tuning.

arguments.name: LOGSCALE=
arguments.description: specifies how to scale the learning rate range.

arguments.name: LOWERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the lower bound of the learning rate range.

arguments.name: SCALEFACTOR=
arguments.description: specifies the factor by which the learning rate range is scaled.

arguments.name: UPPERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the upper bound of the learning rate range.

arguments.name: VALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the value to use for the learning rate.

arguments.name: VALUELIST=
arguments.description: specifies a list of candidate values to use for the learning rate.

arguments.name: MAXEVALS=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of evaluations for the L-BFGS solver.

arguments.name: MAXITERS
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of iterations for the L-BFGS solver.

arguments.name: NUMCORRECTIONS
arguments.description: specifies the number of corrections used in the L-BFGS update.

arguments.name: TOLERANCECHANGE
arguments.description: specifies the convergence criterion of function change for the L-BFGS solver.

arguments.name: TOLERANCEGRAD
arguments.description: specifies the first-order stopping tolerance for the L-BFGS solver.

arguments.name: SGD
arguments.description: SGD includes the following options:

arguments.name: DAMPENING=
arguments.description: specifies the dampening for momentum of the SGD method.

arguments.name: INITVALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the initial dampening value to begin tuning.

arguments.name: LOGSCALE=
arguments.description: specifies how to scale the dampening range.

arguments.name: LOWERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the lower bound of the dampening range.

arguments.name: SCALEFACTOR=
arguments.description: specifies the factor by which the dampening range is scaled.

arguments.name: UPPERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the upper bound of the dampening range.

arguments.name: VALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the value to use for the dampening parameter.

arguments.name: VALUELIST=
arguments.description: specifies a list of candidate values to use for the dampening parameter.

arguments.name: LR
arguments.description: specifies learning rate options as a space-separated list of one or more name-value pairs.

arguments.name: INITVALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the initial learning rate to start tuning.

arguments.name: LOGSCALE=
arguments.description: specifies how to scale the learning rate range.

arguments.name: LOWERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the lower bound of the learning rate range.

arguments.name: SCALEFACTOR=
arguments.description: specifies the factor by which the learning rate range is scaled.

arguments.name: UPPERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the upper bound of the learning rate range.

arguments.name: VALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the value to use for the learning rate.

arguments.name: VALUELIST=
arguments.description: specifies a list of candidate values to use for the learning rate.

arguments.name: MOMENTUM=
arguments.description: specifies the momentum of the SGD method.

arguments.name: INITVALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the initial momentum value to begin tuning.

arguments.name: LOGSCALE=
arguments.description: specifies how to scale the momentum range.

arguments.name: LOWERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the lower bound of the momentum range.

arguments.name: SCALEFACTOR=
arguments.description: specifies the factor by which the momentum range is scaled.

arguments.name: UPPERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the upper bound of the momentum range.

arguments.name: VALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the value to use for the momentum parameter.

arguments.name: VALUELIST=
arguments.description: specifies a list of candidate values to use for the momentum parameter.

arguments.name: NESTEROV
arguments.description: when True, use Nesterov momentum.

arguments.name: WEIGHT_DECAY
arguments.description: specifies the weight decay (L2 penalty) of the optimizer.

arguments.name: INITVALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the initial weight decay value to begin tuning.

arguments.name: LOGSCALE=
arguments.description: specifies how to scale the weight decay range.

arguments.name: LOWERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the lower bound of the weight decay range.

arguments.name: SCALEFACTOR=
arguments.description: specifies the factor by which the learning rate range is scaled.

arguments.name: UPPERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the upper bound of the learning rate range.

arguments.name: VALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the value to use for the learning rate.

arguments.name: VALUELIST=
arguments.description: specifies a list of candidate values to use for the learning rate.

arguments.name: BATCHSIZE=
arguments.description: specifies the batch size options of the optimizer.

arguments.name: INITVALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the initial batch size to begin tuning.

arguments.name: LOGSCALE=
arguments.description: specifies how to scale the batch size range.

arguments.name: LOWERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the lower bound of the batch size range.

arguments.name: SCALEFACTOR=
arguments.description: specifies the factor by which the batch size range is scaled.

arguments.name: UPPERBOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the upper bound of the batch size range.

arguments.name: VALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the value to use for the batch size parameter.

arguments.name: VALUELIST=
arguments.description: specifies a list of candidate values to use for the batch size parameter.

arguments.name: MAXEPOCHS=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of epochs.

arguments.name: OBJECTIVE=
arguments.description: specifies the loss function for the optimization method.

arguments.name: CROSS_ENTROPY
arguments.description: uses the cross entropy loss function.

arguments.name: MSE
arguments.description: uses the mean squared error loss function.

arguments.name: NLL
arguments.description: uses the negative log likelihood loss function.

arguments.name: SEED=
arguments.description: specifies the random number seed value for the random number generator in SGD.

statements.name: TARGET
statements.description: Specifies the target variables used in the analysis.

arguments.name: variables
arguments.description: specifies a list of variables in the data table that are used as the training target.
